message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with visual learning problems, such as object classification and action recognition, which are typically studied in the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) communities. The paper proposes a method for feature and region selection in the bag-of-words (BoW) model, which is a popular approach in computer vision for visual recognition tasks. This method involves optimizing latent variables jointly with the parameters of a classifier, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also deals with spatio-temporal regions in videos, which is a topic studied in multimedia (cs.MM) research. Finally, the paper discusses connections with multiple kernel learning and multiple instance learning approaches, which are topics studied in information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG) research.
